title: 5 shot at Greene Co. nightclub
content:
GREENE COUNTY, AL (WBRC) -
Greene County Sheriff's deputies are asking for the public's help to solve a club shooting that injured five people this weekend.
It happened between 1 a.m. and 2 a.m. Sunday in the town of Union.
The club sits on Earnest Friday Road. Signs at the club say Dr. Rocks but people in the neighborhood around the building also refer to it as Howard's.
At least four of the victims have non-life threatening injuries according Lt. Jeremy Rancher with the Greene County Sheriff's Office. A fifth victim was take to UAB and his condition is unknown at this time.
The son of woman who lives near the club tells WBRC he now fears for her safety.
"A bullet could have so easily struck her. So I'm very much concerned about that. And I'm very much concerned about this kind of activity going on in the community," said John Burton.
No one has been charged in the shooting and investigators haven't released a motive in the case.
Lt. Rancher said they expect to make several arrests in the case over the next few days.
